caption: Always great!!
Great place! I went here for a birthday and they have delicious food. I got the pasta and so did a few other people. No one had any complaints. The salads were delicious too
Such good food! Their Greek village salad and Beet salads are out of this world! We also hosted my brother's birthday here a few years ago, they were so accommodating and friendly.

Cool ambience, very clean, delicious food, friendly staff that you can tell are smiling even though they’re wearing masks, and nice portions. Thank you Elia for the great dinner and a special thank you to my server, Ryan.
Great food and service.
We’ve been to this restaurant numerous times, and they are always consistent. Excellent food.

I got a moldy olive in my martini and the bartender was super apologetic of that fact that the owner makes them use vodka instead of vermouth or gin to save a couple of bucks. I went once pre-covid and saw him shoo patrons out to overturn tables.  The food isn’t even authentically Greek.  Saw a review down below that emphasized that they are Michelin reviewed and not awarded. It made me LOL. They have a great point!  I won’t support mean and sketchy business owners. I wish I could give zero stars!
Consistently delicious

Cosy restaurant with great service and high quality food. The appetizer sampler offered a variety of dips and pita for sharing. The grilled octopus was tender and delicious.  Moussaka was rich,  creamy and filling. Highly recommend.

Overpriced ! The appetizer was a joke for 6 people! This very  large platter comes out with a smear of 3 different types of appetizers we ordered in the center. It was embarrassing since I took my family out for dinner.! The lemon chicken was supposed to be grilled It was a small slimy thigh with mushy over cooked vegetables! I asked for lemon slices for our water which I asked 3 times. Out comes dried slices that were brownish in color on the rims ! Should have been thrown out ! Left there hungry!
Food was amazing.....excellent service very hospitable and dessert was absolutely to die for... highly recommended when you are around staten island...
Great greek food 💛
(Translated by Google) Ermoso the restaurant  (Original) Ermoso el restaurant

A very cozy restaurant with incredible food and good wine. My friends and I were immediately impressed with friendly vibe of the place and the attentive service. Will definitely be returning here to try their fig martini.
The best
The food was not Great it was also over priced I wouldn't go back
Welcome to Greece in Brooklyn
I do not understand why people like this place. It’s over priced and average. If they had competition they would not survive.  Bay Ridge lacks Greek restaurants.  Food is bland, not memorable.
Very Expensive...STAY AWAY...AGAIN STAY AWAY
Fantastic dinner, friendly service and cozy ambiance!
My absolute favorite restaurant for over 20 years. Every meal I've had has been exceptional. Service is exceptional. Super fresh and delicious food and lovely ambiance.

Very well kept and convenient restaurant. They offer big meals and for economical prices. We loved the food very much and the staff were very welcoming and explanatory. Will definitely recommend this spot.
Very good Greek food

While the food is great it is very expensive and not really authentic. For example the lamb chops tasted good but were way overpriced and not grilled like Greek lamb chops. Lots of dishes were actually similar to Greek but made in a different way, I assume to justify the high price. For example, the rizogalo (rice pudding) on the menu was the least Greek thing and was only rizogalo in name and was way over priced. I enjoyed the meal but I really wouldn't go back as I've eaten at better Greek places that were more authentic and a lot cheaper.

Pete was a an awesome host. He treats us like family every time we head to this Greek gem located in the heart of Brooklyn. Everything on the menu is cooked to perfection. Some of my favorite dishes are the lamb chops, the lamb ravioli and the lamb shank (which falls off the bone and melts in your mouth). Their fish is out of this world and the chef adds his own personal flare to every dish. I look forward to my next meal at Elia and having Pete there to open us with open arms and a lively personality.
The octopus.

Delicious, delicious and delicious! Their baklava is to die for ! Had a great time , the service is amazing ( I had a young lady in blue top as my server ) and she was awesome 👏 I will most definitely come back again :)
(Translated by Google) Everything very beautiful.  (Original) Muy bonito todo.
Very good food and the staff are very friendly
Food was alright, but service was bad

This restaurant is fantastic. The staff is extremely friendly and the food is wonderful. Great wine selection and vibe. It’s relatively empty at least on the weekends. Definitely try some appetizers, they have one which they set on fire.

This is one of the best Greek restaurants in Brooklyn. From appetizers to desserts it is an all around taste experience.  We started with the grilled octopus. What can I say? There are no words to describe how yummy this was. I can't wait to return to try it again.  Next we moved on to the branzino deboned of course. I never want to work that hard to eat my food. If I had any complaints it would be that the fish didn't have enough meat. It must have been on a diet before it was caught. But despite the lightness or was still well prepared and tasty. I'm willing to call this one and off night for branzino. I added a side of Swiss chard. I like veggies so you almost can't mess then up for me.  The best part was the rice pudding dessert. It was just the right balance of sweetness.  The surroundings were very nice. I like the brick walls painted white giving you the feel of the white buildings you'd see in Greece.  I'm definitely adding this place to my list of preferred eating places and will return. Hope to see you there!
Awful place.
Great food and great wine!  Pleasantly surprised!!!
Amazing Fish Specials!
Expenses and food was no good, small place. The only Greek there was owner the rest was Mexican.

wonderful food! nice service. the place was unexpectedly small, but very cozy and friendly, more casual then fancy, I would say family oriented, but you can do friends gathering, couples, anything really. definitely would go there again
typical old fashioned greek restaurant food and service are above average

This restaurant is pricey and has poor service. Got my leg drenched when the waitress was pouring water and never came back to clean it up. Never came back to see if there was anything else we needed, not even refills on water.service does not match the prices. IHOP has better sercice. Shame.
great food, nice and quite atmosphere
Great lamb chops and apps!!
Great appertizers, good food, reasonably priced, nice atmosphere
Favorite Greek restaurant in Bay Ridge.
Good service, great food and drinks. Authentic, high quality Greek cuisine.  Enjoyable atmosphere. A good time.
Top Notch excellent food excellent service.
Food was good but not excellent. Felt they nickel-dimed for everything, such as even an extra pita.
Elia, which means olive in Greek, has delicious traditional Greek foods served with a nice presentation.
Lamb shank with rissotto is delicious.
I love their pomegranate couscous and shrimp
Excellent food, great selection s, would go back.
Strong drinks. ;)
hey this is Miriam from the Balabusta Brooklyn Agency and it is a PLEASURE working with you :)
Great experience great food and excellent service
Great Greek food and great service by an attentive staff. Very comfortable and cozy.

Food is great, service is not that great. For the group of 9 ppl, 20% tip was added, but services was not good... i dont think it's fair to the customers.. tip is voluntary.  20 -25% is the norm in NYC, but we expect service,  which we didnt have here at Elia.
excellent food
Food was delicious. Service was slow and not particularly friendly. Excellent roast chicken, lamb shank and lemon potatoes. Recommend.
Such a consistently great place. Every time I go, I wonder why I don't eat here more. Then the check comes and I remember that it's because I can't afford to. Totally worth it though.
Nice intimate atmosphere.

I found the place overpriced and disappoint thing. While it does have valet parking we did not find the cuisine all that special. Portions was small. It is a nice formal place and there is little noise between tables and service is excellent. I would guess if you liked the food it would be a good thing. We found that we get better value at other Greek and Middle Eastern or Mediterranean restaurants in Bay Ridge at far lower prices with similar if not better cuisine.
Food is decent, prices are fair, service is fast
Amazing Dishes!!!$$!
Always on their game. All the fish is fresh. Old world atmosphere.

We walked in with high expectations, I admit, but shouldn't expectations be high considering all the rave reviews? Listen I'm no food critic, okay? I'm not, but the food was simply bad. It was all under seasoned and "head scratchingly" expensive. The photos looked amazing on the iPad menus so our party of 5 had a difficult time deciding on dishes but when the entrees were placed in front of us, we had to ask the waiter if there was some mistake? For example, one of the things we ordered was a beautifully depicted whole fish (from the iPad menu). What was served however was only part of the midsection of a fish just below the head and substantially above the tail. The response from the waiter was, "That's all we have", and then he walked off. We all tried a piece.... verdict? A cat would have trouble eating that. We also tried the Greek inspired paella... once again, looked amazing in the photo, but underwhelming and under seasoned. And again, the ravioli?... c'mon guys. What's going on? Are you being sabotaged by the staff? Do they want you to close down? Seriously, don't waste your money. You will regret it if you have an experience like we had. Instead, we wished we were at Mezze over on 13th Ave. Now that's amazing authentic Greek food done the right way. No misleading photos or subpar food served there. Its unpretentious comfort food and half the price to boot. Sorry Elia... we were excited to try what you could do with the Greek cuisine - especially when we saw that you "apparently" earned a "Michelin Star", which is a hallmark of fine dining quality and restaurants around the world. Holy cow, was someone paid off? Incredibly disappointing. Seriously, if it continues like that, you will need Gordon Ramsay there to scream at the chefs and staff if you want to save your business. Good luck.
High end Greek restaurant. Excellent food and wine selection. Make reservations ahead of time.

Overwhelmingly accommodating staff (Cedric the French waiter was awesome, knowledgeable and patient) and excellent authentic Greek food. My eyes were bigger than my stomach because of the perfectly balanced menu.  I enjoyed everything (except for Greek Salad-but really that's hit or miss depending on the tomato freshness).  Always grab the Amethysto bottle of wine.  Perfectly balanced for all appetizers on the menu.  This place is a pleasant surprise for this local boy.
The best Greek around expensive but worth it
A top pick in Bay Ridge!  In the warm months the garden dining is great!

Very nice place. Not sure if tablet menu is the right choice for this particular place. I feel like real menu would be better for the atmosphere. Other than that, the food, service and atmosphere were great. I had grilled shrimps - highly recommend them.

Love this Greek gem in Bay Ridge! Recently came with friends for dinner and we all enjoyed our entire Elia experience. Food was excellent - Greek salad, flaming cheese, spreads, bread and even their olive oil! Lamb shank was enormous, enough to take some home for one lucky dog! Whole fish was was prepared simply and totally hit the spot. Elia continues to be a delightful destination. Highly recommended
(Translated by Google) Good food  (Original) Buena comida
Good food but quite pricey, felt underwhelmed. Expected more for the amount of money I paid.
Great Greek food.  Best kept secret in Brooklyn

I expected much more from this restaurant. Although it has been around for years and it is even rumored to have had a Michelin Star, I never hear much about it. I'm not sure if my expectations were too high, but my experience was not too great. Nothing about the menu actually jumps out at you and the husband and wife proprietors need to learn more about customer service.
Terrific greek food in a nice setting. Starters are great and the fish entrees are excellent.
I gem in Bay Ridge!  Great Greek food!  Fantastic wines.
A warm welcoming restaurant with dishes that seem to come from Greece, and not Bay Ridge.  A fine restaurant with many special dishes, made with local ingredients.

"""Found this wonderful restaurant on Zagat. With its 26 food rating and great customer reviews, we were exited to give it a try. We were not disappointed and the 4 of us would rate it as one of the best dinners ever. The lamb shank is to die for. The bronzino was cooked perfect and even the chicken was the best ever. Ditto for the soup, salad, flamed cheese and rice pudding. We will return.""  2nd visit on 7/13/11. Everything as wonderful."
